A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
I have a lot of issues with the plot\, but what's bothering me the most is the asinine battle at the beginning of the movie and the ensuing... chase.

SPOILER ALERT... I forgive a lot of Star Wars physics\, but this is just total nonsense. A new type of super ship is introduced\, a dreadnought\, far bigger than a star destroyer. A fleet killer!!! Thankfully\, a single X-Wing can dismantle all of its defenses. Also\, one small load of bombs\, which for some reason are "dropped" in space\, completely destroys it. Cool...

But then we get to the real meat of the plot... the chase. You see\, the resistance ships must use their remaining fuel to stay just out of range of the First Order ships. But for some reason\, despite being faster\, they never actually get away. They stay perpetually "just" out of range. Neat...

We also discover that a ship jumping to light speed can basically wreck a whole fleet. Why do they even have laser cannons?

Oof... everything just feels so forced. Phasma is totally shoehorned in.They go overboard with the cute creatures. Way too many silly moments. Snoke's character is wasted. Rey is poorly developed. I still don't know what was going on with Luke. Overall it just feels like a plot spread too thin.

The only saving grace is a fight scene with Snoke's guard. We get to see some vibroweapons. I'm gonna watch this again to see if maybe I'm being too hard on it but right now 1.9 of my stars are for the vibroweapons.
